channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Nicola Sturgeon may ease lockdown in Scotland
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon today signalled she is willing to ease coronavirus restrictions in Scotland independently of the UK government as Northern Ireland also appeared set to follow suit.

item.title: Coronavirus Germany: Angela Merkel fears early lockdown ease
item.description: Germany has begun reopening schools and non-essential shops while Spain has announced children will be allowed out of the house as lockdowns ease, as their leaders urged caution.

item.title: Dozens of mafia bosses could be released in Italy
item.description: Three Italian mob bosses from the infamous and violent Cosa Nostra and 'Ndrangheta clans have already been allowed to leave jail, and are now under house arrest.

item.title: Millionaire Castaway David Glasheen reveals his top tips for living in isolation
item.description: David Glasheen, 76, has been living on Restoration Island off the coast of north Australia since 1997 after losing his wealth. He hunts for food and goes grocery shopping once a year in Cairns.

item.title: Dominic Cummings lifts the lid on isolation with wife and young son when he was ill with coronavirus
item.description: Journalist Mary Wakefield revealed that Mr Cummings, 48, spent 10 days bedridden with the disease after coming home to nurse her through a milder case.

item.title: Sweden's coronavirus cases grow more slowly than Britain's despite lack of lockdown
item.description: Over the last three days, Sweden added an average of 53 cases per million people, whereas Britain's figure was 66 despite a shutdown which has now been in place for a month.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 18,689 with 589 new fatalities
item.description: Today's statistics come as deep rifts are emerging in Government over when and how the UK will move out of its current lockdown state as the coronavirus infection rate starts to fall.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Builders line up at construction sites
item.description: Crowds gathered outside the Five Guys restaurant at Edinburgh's Fountain Park at about 7pm yesterday, waiting for takeaway orders, as Britain shows signs it is getting back to work.

item.title: The senior civil servant running the company at centre of Britain's PPE coronavirus shambles
item.description: Jin Sahota, 52, is the £200,000-a-year chief executive of Supply Chain Co-ordination Limited (SCCL) which is the management arm of the NHS supply operation.

item.title: Diary found that tells of Bletchley park's codebreaker's romance with German woman
item.description: Becky Edmunds found 12 diaries on a pile of rubbish in Brighton that uncover the romance story of an Enigma team codebreaker and a German woman torn between her love and her Nazi-loyalist sons.

item.title: SpaceX is 'fixing' the brightness of its Starlink satellites
item.description: Elon Musk is 'fixing' the issue of SpaceX satellites disrupting the night sky for stargazers. Brits have been left confused by the Starlink satellites - the latest batch of which launched yesterday.

item.title: Hottest day of the year during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Today is set to be one of the hottest days of the year in Britain with the highest temperatures reaching 75F (23C) with Britons stuck inside isolating in lockdown.

item.title: Hottest day of the year during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Today is set to be one of the hottest days of the year in Britain with the highest temperatures reaching 75F (23C) with Britons stuck inside isolating in lockdown.

item.title: Kate Middleton dressed Prince Louis in a £12 Tu check bodysuit
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge opted to dress Prince Louis in a £12 Tu check bodysuit from Sainsbury's to take the adorable pictures released for the royal's 2nd birthday today.

item.title: UK's testing farce: Drive-thru centres are only swabbing 'four people a day'
item.description: Damning official figures show Britain is still miles away from reaching its pledge of swabbing 100,000 people each day, with statistics showing only 13,500 Britons were tested yesterday.

item.title: Forensic scientist, 46, wins case after her boss asked if she didn't like him because she is gay
item.description: Jo Millington, one of Britain's leading forensic scientists, was 'upset and embarrassed' when Joe Arend confronted her and brought up her sexuality, an employment tribunal in Reading, Berkshire heard.

item.title: One of Britain's first coronavirus vaccine volunteers reveals side effects
item.description: One of the first Brits to sign up for the coronavirus vaccination scheme has spoken about what he expects to happen. Simeon Courties, speaking from Oxfordshire, is taking part in the trial that starts today.

item.title: Coronavirus is unlikely to be spread through semen, scientists say - but they can't rule it out
item.description: A study examined semen samples of 34 men in China who had suffered with mild COVID-19 a month prior. Researchers did not find any evidence of the virus in semen.

item.title: Sue Martin says husband Mal has had tracheotomy but isn't strong enough to be weaned off ventilator
item.description: Sue Martin, 49, from Cardiff, tweeted to say her husband Mal, 58, underwent a tracheotomy yesterday to make him more comfortable and lessen his sedation.

item.title: Covidiot 'tries to run over' swan in a speedboat and circles around the distressed bird
item.description: Olivia Satchwell, 18, filmed a speedboat driver repeatedly circling around a swan at a boating lake in Little Paxton, Cambridgeshire. She believes the driver was trying to run it over.

item.title: Nurse who won giveaway contest was refused her prize because she was working 12 hour shift
item.description: Lara Harper, from Glasgow, who entered a competition for NHS workers has told how she was refused the prize after she was unable to join their live event due to working on the frontline.

item.title: Knife crime soars by 7% to highest ever level with 45,627 offences in England and Wales in 2019
item.description: The number of recorded knife crimes in England and Wales has soared by 7 per cent to its highest ever level, with a third of all recorded offences taking place in London, according to the ONS.

item.title: Boris Johnson well enough to chat to the Queen on the phone and gets 'regular' updates from aides
item.description: Officials insisted the PM was not working at Chequers as he continues his recuperation from his brush with the pandemic and has not set a date to return to No 10.

item.title: Mansion where Roxy Music and Pink Floyd recorded hits on the market for £6m
item.description: St Ann's Court, near Chertsey in Surrey, was where Roxy Music and members of Pink Floyd, The Jam and Soft Machine recorded many of their hits.

item.title: Police freeze £1.6million from 'complex web' of 25 bank accounts linked to mafia cash
item.description: Investigators from the Met Police Economic Crime Unit found that dozens of front companies were opened in the UK as gangsters used fake identities, including that of a dead man.

item.title: Coronavirus Europe: Nearly half of deaths were in care homes
item.description: The WHO's European director Hans Kluge revealed the staggering figure at a press conference today where he labelled the deaths an 'unimaginable human tragedy'.

item.title: Twitter acts against `unverified claims´ inciting 5G
item.description: The social network said it is taking action to prevent misinformation about the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Scientists identify the cells in human lungs, nose and intestines most vulnerable to COVID-19
item.description: An international team of experts used a database of which genes are turned on by which cells to identify the cell types which produce the two proteins COVID-19 uses to enter and infect cells.

item.title: Sixth Uber driver death linked to coronavirus prompt urgent calls for minicabs to be issued PPE
item.description: Zahid Pervaiz, 65, from High Wycombe, is the latest to die after picking up a passenger he believed was infected by Covid-19. Families, MPs and drivers' associations have pleaded for PPE.

item.title: Police fear for safety to two teenage girls who went missing together in Derby on Saturday
item.description: Police are concerned about the safety of Amanda Ditrichova, 14, and Vanesa Magyarova, 15, who went missing in Derby on Saturday.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two thirds say journalists are NOT doing a good job of questioning ministers
item.description: Political reporters have been the main opposition for Ministers following Parliament shutting down for a month after voting through unprecedented lockdown measures.

item.title: China says Wuhan has two critical COVID-19 patients and promises to give the WHO $30 million more
item.description: The news comes as another major Chinese city with around 10 million people has adopted draconian quarantine measures to curb a new COVID-19 outbreak.

item.title: Champions League qualification 'will be decided on sporting merit' if season can't be finished
item.description: The decision would secure a Champions League spot next season for the Premier League's current top four of Liverpool, City, Leicester and Chelsea, with United, Tottenham and Arsenal missing out.

item.title: Prince Charles warned about environmental impact luxury wedding venue at his Scottish stately home
item.description: Prince Charles has been warned of the environmental impact of building a luxury wedding venue in the grounds of his Scottish stately home - a day after he urged others to protect the planet.

item.title: Ethnic minority medics account for 72 per cent of all NHS Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Mr Manjeet Singh Riyat, pictured, was the first Sikh to be appointed an Emergency Consultant in a British hospital. Mr Riyat worked at the Royal Derby Hospital who praised his dedication and hard work.

item.title: Vegan mum, who cleared £40K of debt by growing her own food, says lockdown is easy
item.description: Amber Allen, 31, a YouTuber from Ontario, Canada, has only 30 items of clothing and lives off the land. She says lockdown should encourage everyone to be more sustainable.

item.title: Captain Tom Moore the TV star: Former Army officer given an ITV documentary to be aired on VE Day
item.description: Captain Tom Moore, originally from Yorkshire, will share his experiences of the Second World War in a 30-minute special, Captain Tom's War, which will be aired on TV on VE Day next month.

item.title: Royal fans claim Prince Louis is 'the image' of Kate Middleton's dad, Michael
item.description: Royal fans have drawn similarities between Prince Louis and Kate Middleton's father, Michael. It comes after Prince William and Kate released photos ahead of their youngest's second birthday.

item.title: Mother giraffe tries in vain to defend its one-day-old calf from a lioness
item.description: The photos were taken in Kenya's Maasai Mara National Park by IT worker Srikanth Santhinathan, 29, from India. They show the mother desperately trying to kick the lioness away.

item.title: Care home staff move into TENTS in 'no one in or out' policy to shield residents from coronavirus
item.description: As part of a 'no-one in, no-out' policy', staff at Victoria House on the Isle of Wight have taken to the drastic measures in a bid to prevent Covid-19 spreading into the home.

item.title: Police officer in hospital after arson attack - man is arrested over his attempted murder
item.description: A police officer is in hospital after an arson attack in the early hours of this morning in Newport, Wales - with a man in his 30s arrested for attempted murder.

item.title: Nearly 90 per cent of COVID-19 patients placed on ventilators in NY's largest health system DIED
item.description: The study, published in the Journal of the American Medical Association on Wednesday, examined the electronic health records of 5,700 patients hospitalized.

item.title: Captain Tom Moore, 99, will receive Pride of Britain award
item.description: Captain Tom Moore, whose fundraiser raised more than £28m for the NHS , will receive a Pride Of Britain award.

item.title: Britain's Deputy Chief Medical Officer believes she had coronavirus
item.description: Speaking to Lorraine Kelly this morning on Good Morning Britain Dr Jenny Harries said she had coronavirus and that it had been an 'unpleasant experience'.

item.title: French researchers plan to give nicotine patches to coronavirus patients and frontline workers
item.description: The moves comes after a new study from Paris, France, found that few people hospitalized, or at home, with coronavirus were regular smokers compared to the general population.

item.title: Princess Beatrice makes her first appearance since cancelling wedding
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 31, opened up about the 'incredibly challenging time' facing the UK and the world in her first public appearance since postponing her May wedding.

item.title: Vietnam eases coronavirus restrictions after reporting zero deaths
item.description: Vietnam eased social distancing measures today, with experts pointing to a decisive response of mass quarantines and expansive contact tracing in the country's success.

item.title: Afghanistan war hero with PTSD reveals how he was talked down from jumping off motorway bridge
item.description: Afghanistan veteran Jason Verez (right) was about to jump to his death before Gary Knight (left) drove past and spent an hour persuading him to come down.

item.title: Trump has coronavirus briefing tantrum over CDC boss' warning of 'even more difficult' second wave
item.description: President Donald Trump raged about media coverage of CDC Director Robert Redfield's warning about a second wave of the coronavirus.

item.title: Scientists discover 19 interstellar asteroids between Jupiter and Neptune
item.description: French astronomers believe the space rocks were ripped from their original location as the universe expanded and the sun was growing.

item.title: Father is stunned to discover motorbike from the 1960s BURIED a metre beneath the flowerbed
item.description: Chris Hopkins, 51, a council housing officer from Bromsgrove, Worcestershire, had been digging for weed free soil when he stumbled across the almost entirely intact bike one metre down.

item.title: Scientists create the first geological map of the lunar surface
item.description: The lunar map, called the Unified Geologic Map of the Moon, has been created by the United States Geological Survey (USGS), NASA and the Lunar Planetary Institute.

item.title: Bin Laden wanted to kill Obama because he thought Joe Biden was totally unprepared to be president
item.description: Declassified documents seized from Bin Laden's Pakistan compound as he was killed in May 2011 reveal his plans to throw the U.S. 'into a crisis' by killing Obama and leaving Joe Biden in charge.

item.title: Germany: Syrian ex-secret police go on trial for war crimes
item.description: BERLIN (AP) - Two former members of Syria's secret police appeared in court in Germany on Thursday accused of crimes against humanity for their role in a...

item.title: Playful Prince! Kensington Palace release a snap of a VERY messy Louis
item.description: Prince Louis, who is celebrating his 2nd birthday today, can be seen beaming in the new picture, which was released on the Kensington Palace Twitter today.

item.title: Prince Charles wishes Prince Louis a happy second birthday
item.description: Prince Charles has released an unseen photo with Prince Louis to mark his grandson's second birthday today.

item.title: Single care home where 11 out of Isle of Man's 15 coronavirus deaths has its licence suspended
item.description: Abbotswood Nursing Home in Ballasalla, Isle of Man had its license suspended on April 13 after nearly 40 residents tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Italian prosecutors are considering criminal trials for health officials
item.description: More than 45,000 people have joined NOI Denunceremo - meaning We will report - which is a Facebook group where testimonies are being gathered for magistrates.

item.title: Disney's theme parks are unlikely to open their gates again until 2021, according to analysts
item.description: Disney's world theme parks may not reopen until 2021 due to strict social distancing measures in force because of coronavirus, ultimately impacting profitability.

item.title: Jet2 pilots on lockdown record hilarious version of travel company's TV advert
item.description: The four-minute long parody is set to the Jess Glynne track Hold My Hand and shows Jet2 East Midlands-based pilots relaxing at home before being 'called back to duty'.

item.title: Army of council staff and civil servant 'will help contact tracing of coronavirus patients'
item.description: Council staff and civil servants will soon be drafted in to reintroduce contact tracing, which the UK Government hopes will mean social distancing measures can slowly be lifted.

item.title: Coronavirus: Almost 400,000 firms apply for furlough help in first three days
item.description: Alok Sharma today revealed almost 400,000 businesses have made applications to the government's coronavirus furlough scheme, covering almost three million workers.

item.title: Fly-tipping ground has so much rubbish it can be seen from space
item.description: The site is piled high with household items with hundreds of car tyres, piles of clothes, suitcases and doors scattered across the disused road off the M4 in Newport, south Wales.

item.title: Britons will 'NOT be told to wear face masks in public
item.description: New UK Government guidance will ask people to wear a face covering, which could be homemade or even just a scarf, whenever they are at work, in shops or on public transport.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Ryanair says planes will NOT fly with empty middle seat
item.description: Ryanair chief executive Michael O'Leary claimed proposals to force planes to fly under capacity when the coronavirus travel restrictions end were 'mad,' unaffordable and 'hopelessly ineffective'.

item.title: France becomes latest country to ban companies registered in offshore tax havens
item.description: The French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire announced today that companies either registered or controlling subsidiaries in tax havens are ineligible for the €110 billion rescue package.

item.title: Woman, 32, awakes from Covid-19 coma to be told she's expecting twins
item.description: Danielle Martin, 32, spent ten days in a coma in a Belfast hospital after contracting Covid-19 in March. When she came around from her coma, medics told her she was expecting twins.

item.title: China puts a city of 10 million 'on lockdown' after detecting new outbreak
item.description: More than 70 people have been infected and over 4,000 are being tested in Harbin, north-eastern China, after the virus was believed to be 'imported' by a student who had returned from the US.

item.title: Britain's economy sinks into deep-freeze as output plummets
item.description: The closely-watched Markit/CIPS Flash UK Composite Purchasing Managers' Index fell to a new record low of 12.9 - down precipitously from an already low reading 36 in March.

item.title: Teenager is charged with rape and sexual offences at Jack and Jill nursery in Devon
item.description: A teenage boy, 17, has been charged with rape and sexual offences against at least eight children at a nursery in Devon.

item.title: Grandmother, 77, breaks down in tears when her husband, 76, surprises her
item.description: Wesley Boyd, 76, from Sydenham, Belfast, came up with the plan to surprise his wife Sadie, 77, after his son Aaron, 39, collected him from the Royal Victoria Hospital following surgery for a twisted bowel.

item.title: Even the deer are socially distancing! Wildlife takes over deserted street outside Cornish pub
item.description: An incredible photo captured on a live webcam shows four deer sticking to social distancing rules as they stand in a row by the Riverside guest house in Boscastle, Cornwall, last Friday amid the lockdown,

item.title: Student nurses juggle working on NHS frontline against coronavirus with completing dissertations
item.description: Student nurse Helen Pickett from Grimsby is being drafted onto the frontline to help the NHS battle coronavirus. More than 10,000 students will do their dissertations at the same time as working.

item.title: Mother reveals her husband's asked for an open marriage so he can have sex with other women
item.description: The British woman, 30, who did not give her name, explained on Mumsnet that her husband wants to rent out a second flat where he can stay and see his 'girlfriends' during the working week.

item.title: Researchers discover rare iPhone flaw that allows hackers to access Apple's iOS remotely
item.description: Security experts uncovered a vulnerability in the Mail app on iOS13 devices, and say it has been users by hackers to steal data 'in the wild' at least six times.

item.title: Best-selling author and foster mother Cathy Glass says she never gets over sexual abuse cases
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Best-selling author Cathy Glass, whose fostering memoirs have sold more than 4.5 million copies worldwide, told Femail she's often the first person a child will tell about sexual abuse.

item.title: These inexpensive features costing less than £100 can add up to £50,000 to the value of your home
item.description: UK-based online tools seller My Tool Shed has revealed its top tips on how to increase your home's value, costing just £765 in total to do - and they can add £50,000 to the value of your house.

item.title: Record company boss, 33, is charged with firearms offences
item.description: Police have charged Michael Alunomoh after a man was seen firing weapons from an apartment in Kent. He will appear before Medway Magistrates' Court later today.

item.title: Bronze Age warriors developed sophisticated sword-fighting techniques
item.description: British researchers studied Bronze Age weapons and modern-day relics to study fighting styles and how they evolved 3,000 years ago.
item.media:credit: Raphael Hermann/ Journal of Archaeological Method and Theory

item.title: North Korean defector 'tests positive for coronavirus' after crossing into China
item.description: The North Korean man was rushed to hospital after being shot by a Chinese border guard while trying to defect on April 20 where he tested positive for coronavirus, a source has said.

item.title: Joker's painstaking attempt to explode a watermelon with rubber bands ends spectacularly
item.description: Jeremiah Warlick, from Jackson, Tennessee, decided to cure his coronavirus lockdown boredom with an hilarious attempt to split a watermelon with hundreds of elastic bands..

item.title: NHS intensive care nurse who helped save Boris Johnson's life says he was 'just another patient'
item.description: Luis Pitarma, 29, and Jenny McGee, 35, were singled out for praise by the Prime Minister after treating him at St Thomas' Hospital in central London. The pair have now spoken for the first time.

item.title: Paul Gascoigne joins friends in garden shed pub before the owner's wife smashes it up
item.description: The former England ace - who has battled alcoholism for years - shared a video of himself in the makeshift pub on social media.

item.title: Police chiefs say they are in constant fear of being sacked by 'arrogant' crime commissioners
item.description: Elected commissioners were introduced to England and Wales in 2012 by home secretary at the time Theresa May, with the goal of making officers more accountable through election.

item.title: Seven-year-old receives over 100 LETTERS - after asking for pen pals
item.description: Harley Glen, seven, from North Yorkshire, appeared on This Morning to thank people from around the world who have written to him since his mother Ashley, 33, put out an online plea for pen pals.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government to send testing kits to 20k homes
item.description: The government is to launch a new study to try and understand the current rate of infection in the UK and how many people have developed antibodies to the coronavirus.

item.title: Saudi human rights activist warned to expect 'the same fate that happened to Jamal Khashoggi'
item.description: Alya Abutayah Alhwaiti claims she received death threats on the phone and on Twitter from people she believes are supporters of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. Pictured is the planned city Neom.

item.title: Furloughed Laura Ashley staff go back to work using their sewing skills to make scrubs for NHS
item.description: The brand will manufacture 3,000 sets of medical uniforms in Newtown, Mid Wales - with 41 staff members returning to the factory, which will see garment making restored to the area.

item.title: 'Promises aren't cutting it': Piers Morgan lays into Brandon Lewis as he defends testing 'shambles'
item.description: Piers Morgan grilled the Northern Ireland Secretary over claims the government has the capacity for 40,000 coronavirus tests but are only doing 22,000, since yesterday.

item.title: NHS supply chief accuses hospitals of stockpiling PPE
item.description: Estimates suggest that frontline workers in the UK currently need around 60,000 masks a week to treat Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Downing Street 'told not to publicise PPE shipment from Turkey' in case it didn't turn up
item.description: Senior officials reportedly warned No 10 that any public confirmation of the plane-load of personal protective equipment (PPE) for NHS staff battling coronavirus could backfire.

item.title: Tory MPs' fury at coronavirus lockdown limbo
item.description: Furious Tory MPs have warned the government it must spell out in detail how it intends to ease the UK's coronavirus lockdown to give businesses hope of survival.

item.title: The Queen's London parks face £750,000 race discrimination fight
item.description: A group of agency-employed cleaners - who are mostly black African - say they are treated differently to the mainly white admin staff who work for London park managers, The Royal Parks Ltd.

item.title: Wife, 68, tragically loses husband, 70, to coronavirus but survives her own battle
item.description: Janet Longcake spent 12 days in hospital after contracting the virus. Yet, her husband, North Lincolnshire Councillor Derek Longcake, tragically passed away on Easter Sunday.

item.title: Nurse who battled coronavirus 'grateful' to be alive
item.description: Nurse Sharon Cook, from Lincolnshire, who urged the public to stay at home to stop the spread of the coronavirus said on GMB she's 'grateful' to be alive after thinking she would die alone in hospital.

item.title: Leftover wine turned bad? Experts reveal ways to avoid pouring it down the sink
item.description: Wine is surprisingly versatile and can be put to use as a cleaning agent, a compost booster and even a fly trap. Here the experts at Cult Wines share their top tips for using up leftover wine with FEMAIL.

item.title: Drunk father who battered his ex-wife in front of their daughter is jailed
item.description: Mohammed Osman, 37, left his ex-wife with a fractured jaw when she tried to go home with their daughter because he was drinking heavily on a Boxing Day family trip in Didsbury, Manchester.

item.title: Savvy mum invents genius challenge to each kids how to meal prep
item.description: Sarah Chick, 32, from Dorset, has a genius challenge to teach her children how to meal prep during lockdown. The mum-of five and stepmum of one

item.title: UK universities face £2.5bn financial 'blackhole' due to 230,000 drop in student numbers
item.description: Tens of thousands of jobs risk being lost if the Government fails to take urgent action according to research. Imperial College London (pictured) has already announced cost saving measures.

item.title: Trinny Woodall's partner Charles Saatchi, 76, accidentally walks into her livestream NAKED
item.description: The style guru, 56, treated her social media followers to some fashion and beauty tips when the businessman, 76, popped into frame before heading into the shower.

item.title: West Midlands chief superintendent thanks NHS for saving his life from Covid-19d
item.description: Chief Superintendent Phil Dolby, pictured, received a round of applause from NHS staff after spending more than three weeks at the Worcester Royal Hospital after contracting Covid 19.

item.title: We try before you buy: CLAIRE COLEMAN tests the best brow-defining pens
item.description: Claire Coleman gives her verdict on a selection of the best brow-defining pens. The British beauty expert was most impressed with Lottie London Arch Rival and GOSH brow hair.

item.title: Photographer uses Zoom and FaceTime to capture images of people at home
item.description: Mikaël Theimer, who was born in Paris and now lives in Montreal, Canada, used Zoom, FaceTime and Facebook messenger to snap shots of people in their opulent homes amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out the best neon brights for effortless style this season
item.description: Dinah Van Tulleken shares advice for embracing this season's neon brights trend. The British style expert also reveals a selection of the best pieces available from online retailers.

item.title: Can YOU name these well-known phrases?
item.description: Nikki Spiers, 31, of London, unwittingly became an international sensation last month when the cryptic emoji quiz she sent to a group of friends via WhatsApp was shared around the world.

item.title: Adorable footage shows beavers larking around a National Trust estate in Exmoor
item.description: Two pairs of beavers were put into two enclosures on the Holnicote Estate in Exmoor, Somerset, as part of the so-called 'Riverlands' project.

item.title: How series three of BBC thriller Killing Eve came to life in some VERY ordinary West London streets
item.description: Fans of the BBC hit drama Killing Eve have been thrilled to spot so many filming locations they recognise from suburban London neighbourhoods in the programme.

item.title: Britons urged to take vitamin D supplements during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: During the autumn and winter, experts advise taking vitamin D in order to make up for the lack of sunlight absorbed into the body. But the NHS is urging people take the supplements now.

item.title: Kate Middleton's photos of Prince Louis on his second birthday
item.description: As he turns two tomorrow, these pictures show that - just other children across Britain - his parents are keeping him busy by painting rainbows.

item.title: Single mother reveals how she transformed her kitchen from drab to fabulous
item.description: Victoria Robinson, 33, a part time Tesco worker from Hertfordshire, took to a Facebook group to share how she turned her drab kitchen into a modern space by swapping her handles and tiles.

item.title: Facebook agreed to censor posts criticising Vietnamese government
item.description: Two Vietnamese state-owned telecommunications companies, knocked Facebook's servers offline for around seven weeks, making the site unusable, two sources said.

item.title: Healthcare workers clash with anti-lockdown rebels across the US and urge protesters to go home
item.description: Healthcare workers took to the streets to counter-demonstrate against anti-lockdown protesters across the US Wednesday, urging social distancing rebels to go home.

item.title: Boy, four, is eaten alive by stray PIGS after wandering out of his house to play in India
item.description: Four-year-old V. Harshavardhan was killed and eaten by a herd of wild pigs near his home in Hyderbad, India. He was playing in an isolated area near his home when the animals dragged him off.

item.title: Two thirds of Britons polled back day off to celebrate medics and care staff
item.description: Two thirds of Britons have said the UK should be given an extra bank holiday to celebrate medics and care staff who battle the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Spotify trick that allows you to listen to music with friends and family in different households
item.description: A little-known Spotify feature allows members to listen to music with friends and family at the same time in different households.

item.title: Hospital CEO is sent death threat after allowing Ross Kemp to film crisis-hit frontline
item.description: Joe Harrison the chief executive of Milton Keynes University Hospital revealed he had been forced to contact the police because of two death threats sent to him after a Ross Kemp documentary

item.title: EuroMillions winner who scooped £58m plans to build his own home
item.description: Self-employed joiner Ryan Hoyle, 38, of Rochdale, Greater Manchester, whose mother works as a school cleaner and father works in a factory, won £58,366,487 in a EuroMillions jackpot.

item.title: What happens to house prices after you stop the property market?
item.description: Amid the coronavirus lockdown, that quintessentially British question is inevitably being asked: what will happen to house prices?

item.title: Kim Jong Un's death could force US and South Korea to take military action
item.description: A power vacuum left by the dictator could explode into an ugly civil war in the North Korea, which would spark 'humanitarian suffering' and a wave of refugees fleeing the violence.

item.title: Why it's time to slip into: The easy-breezy dress
item.description: Anna Pursglove shares her advice for embracing this season's midi dress trend at any occasion. The British style expert said the High Street has turned it's back on recent catwalk styles.

item.title: Five-year-old children are inherently sexist, study claims
item.description: Hostile sexist views decrease with age for boys and girls - but more benevolent, patronising but well-meaning sexist views stick around in boys until age 11 at least, a new US study suggests.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Social distancing beyond Christmas?
item.description: Professor Chris Whitty said social distancing measures cannot be lifted until either a vaccine for Covid-19 or 'highly effective' drugs to treat the virus become available.

item.title: Heartbreaking photo of a quarantined bulldog looking dejected on his balcony goes viral
item.description: Rashida Ellis, 38, from Atlanta, Georgia, took to Twitter on Tuesday to post a snapshot of her three-year-old dog Big Poppa looking sad.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: If we love the NHS, why sue it for £83bn?
item.description: MARTIN SAMUEL We love our NHS. We lionise our NHS. We clap, and ring bells and bang pots and let off fireworks for the NHS every week.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Heathrow Airport houses 30 homeless sleepers
item.description: Mike, who did not want to reveal his last name, has been sleeping in Terminal 5 since lockdown started three weeks ago after being ordered to leave a hostel. Prior to that he was sleeping rough.

item.title: Chinese journalist who went missing in Wuhan after Covid-19 reporting re-appears two months later
item.description: Li Zehua was one of three Chinese journalists reporting from Wuhan's frontlines during its coronavirus epidemic who mysteriously disappeared. Two months later a video of Li has emerged online.

item.title: The murders most foul: Almost 50 years later, is the bunny girl killer still on the loose?
item.description: In our Murders most foul series we've looked at super sleuths and crimes of passion. Today we have unsolved murders committed by the playboy bunny killer, Bible John and the Man from Pru.

item.title: Former Eton headmaster Eric Anderson dies aged 83
item.description: Former Eton College Head Master Sir Eric Anderson, who was in charge of the school between 1980 and 1994 and whose pupils included Boris Johnson and David Cameron, has died at the age of 83.

item.title: Woman who lost her sister, brother and father to illness dies despite mum donating kidney
item.description: Suzanne Shipley, 34 and from Warrington, was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes at the age of 14, after which followed years of devastating health conditions. She died from kidney failure.

item.title: Dietitian shares the healthy five-ingredient banana bread she swears by for beating sugar cravings
item.description: A dietitian has shared the five-ingredient healthy banana bread she swears by for beating sugar cravings - and it's as easy to make as the unhealthier three-ingredient counterpart.

item.title: Macquarie University dr Juliana Chen reveals the simple tricks to overcome COVID-19 comfort eating
item.description: Australian doctor Juliana Chen has warned making unhealthy lifestyle choices during the coronavirus pandemic can have a negative impact on your health in the long run.

item.title: NHS staff criticised for dancing
item.description: Groups of nurses from wards in the likes of London, Buckinghamshire, Leeds and Wolverhampton have created the videos using the TikTok app.

item.title: Filter coffee drinkers are 15 per cent less likely to die from a heart attack, study shows
item.description: Preparing your morning brew using a filter-based approached is best to avoid heart problems and lower cholesterol - and is better for you than not drinking coffee, European researchers found.

item.title: JANE FRYER recalls the man who revolutionised the entertainment industry
item.description: JANE FRYER: By the time he was 23, Ronan O'Rahilly had fled his native Ireland for London, was running a successful club in Soho, The Scene and set up a record label.

item.title: If this goes on for six months, 50,000 more people could die of cancer
item.description: KAROL SIKORA: When this pandemic emerged, Government ministers were understandably fearful that the NHS could be overwhelmed by the sheer number of infected patients.

item.title: Missing your mani? Time to go tonal!
item.description: Claire Coleman revealed tonal nails are this season's must-have beauty trend across the world. The look has been spotted on the hands of stars including Gigi Hadid and Kylie Jenner.

item.title: I'm loving lockdown with a much younger man (but I really miss my cleaner)
item.description: Beverley Turner who lives in London, reflects on isolating with her three children aged 16, 11 and nine, as well as her partner of only a year James Pritchett, 32.

item.title: 'Empty' Nightingale hospitals could be used to treat non-coronavirus patients
item.description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said empty beds at the seven Nightingales around the country may be used for cases including cancer sufferers or 'stepdown' patients on the road to recovery.

item.title: Heart attack and stroke victims have to wait more than TWO HOURS for an ambulance
item.description: EXCLUSIVE Emergency response times are the worst on record as paramedics face a surge in demand at a time when many are off sick.

item.title: Disney heir slams the company for furloughing 100,000 staff amid coronavirus closures
item.description: Abigail Disney slammed Walt Disney Co. Tuesday as the company stopped paying 100,000 furloughed workers. The heiress claimed the company was protecting executive bonuses and dividends.

item.title: Secret buyer of the Ritz who paid £800m is Qatari businessman Abdulhadi Mana Al-Hajri
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: After The Ritz was snapped up last month for £800million making it the most expensive hotel in the world, people have wondered who bought it.

item.title: SpaceX launches its Falcon 9 carrying 60 new Starlink satellites and marking its 84th flight
item.description: SpaceX hit a milestone today after launching its Falcon 9 carrying a new batch of 60 Starlinks satellites. This is its 84th mission, which more than another currently operational US rocket.

item.title: SUSANNA REID: I've made my own mask, but why aren't we all wearing one?
item.description: Susanna Reid says she was the only person wearing a face mask when she went on her daily walk. British presenter argues the government should clarify the confusion around masks.

item.title: Who'll find love on our virtual date? This week it's Felicity, 40, and James, 40,
item.description: Every week, FEMAIL sends two UK singletons on a virtual blind date amid lockdown. Felicity, 40, who is a freelance publicist and business owner James, 40, reported back on their date.

item.title: The violent rampage of Diane Abbott's diplomat son James Abbott-Thompson
item.description: The terrified MP called police begging for help when James Abbott-Thompson began chasing her round her house with the scissors while claiming he had a gun in his dressing gown.

item.title: Sleuth who turned the tables on the lonely hearts scammers
item.description: Suzanne Parker, 71, who lives in Bristol, has identified the warning signs to look out for when using online dating websites. She argues sites should vet their members in the early stage.

item.title: Crane comeback continues as population reaches 400-year high
item.description: Conservation work and reintroductions have helped boost the UK´s tallest bird, which went extinct here in the 1600s.
item.media:description: Common cranes have made a return to the UK (Andy Hay/RSPB/PA)

item.title: Pope warns mankind has 'ruined the work of God and sinned against the Earth' on World Earth Day
item.description: During his address on the 50th anniversary of the first World Earth Day (pictured) Pope Francis spoke about how he sees natural tragedies are 'the Earth's response to our maltreatment.'

item.title: Merseyside nursery teacher upstaged by horses as she records lockdown story time video for her kids
item.description: Eloise Roberts, from Moreton, Merseyside, was shocked when her horses interrupted her story time video with an x-rated display. The 32-year-old burst out laughing at the amorous horses.

item.title: Last year was Europe's hottest year EVER recorded
item.description: Figures from the European state of the climate report from the EU's Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) also reveals 11 of the 12 warmest years on record for the continent occurred since 2000.

item.title: Apocalyptic scenes in Chernobyl as drone footage reveals devastation
item.description: Firefighters fought back the flames for almost two weeks, hyper-aware that the inferno was creeping towards the site of the exploded nuclear plant in Chernobyl, Ukraine.

item.title: Woman reveals we've all been sealing cereal boxes wrong
item.description: British TikTok user Katy Bee left followers amazed when she revealed that you've probably been closing cereal boxes all wrong, and shared her trick for doing it the right way.

item.title: Heartbroken family of missing estate agent Chelsie Dack fear she may have killed herself
item.description: Norfolk Police said CCTV footage showed Chelsie Dack walking towards the pier, where her mobile phone was found by a member of the public later that morning.
